extendedInfo.description: With Evernote Hello itâs easy to remember everything about everyone you meet.Whether you're meeting someone for the first time, trying to remember important details about a person youâve met before, or recalling important information about a previous meeting, Evernote Hello is here to help. Here's how:- See everyone youâve met and pictures of your activities in a beautiful mosaic layout- View a history of all the meetings you've had with individuals- Remember all aspects of your meetings: location, notes, photos, and faces- Connect with people through LinkedIn and now Facebook- Get additional insights about contacts and meetings with Related Notes from your Evernote accountThere are three easy ways to bring people you meet into Evernote Hello:- Connect with nearby Evernote Hello users via Hello Connect- Pull their information from your calendar appointments, texts, calls or your address book- Create a quick profile and snap their photo manuallyWith Evernote Hello, you can easily remember everyone you meet.Evernote Hello is part of the Evernote family of products, which are designed to help you remember everything.

reviews.title: Business Card Picture and LinkedIn Interface
reviews.comment: This app is the only thing that made my transition from IOS to Android less than perfect. This app is quite lagging in functionality with regards to its IOS counterpart, namely no means by which to scan a business card and the Linkedin profile picture connection is not as user-friendly.  Waiting for Evernote to deliver on promises in their blog to make this app equivalent to its iOS counterpart, for over 4 months....have now lowered my rating to 1*.
reviews.author: Antonio Salvador

reviews.title: Good idea needs some fine tuning
reviews.comment: It would be awesome if there was an option to import all your phones contacts to hello at once instead of just one by one because that takes really long if you want to do them all.
reviews.author: Kelvin Lu

reviews.title: Disapointing
reviews.comment: No Business card scanning - the only reason I downloaded after seeing a promo video, not worth it until this feature is added.
reviews.author: Ali Grainger

reviews.title: Waste of time!
reviews.comment: Find an alternative OCR app to scan business cards, Evernote Hello is a complete waste of time.  My phone\'s built in contact features are much better at organizing contacts, and they\'re synced to google and across all my devices instantly.
reviews.author: Jeremy Jones

reviews.title: Need business card scan on Nexus 7: 2013
reviews.comment: Good app but need business card scanning ability for Nexus 7 (2013).
reviews.author: Suresh Raja

reviews.title: Just bad
reviews.comment: Crashes when i tap the of she meeting. There is no (easily discoverable) way to link an existing note to a contact, so if intend to organize your pile of notes tagged \"contact\" - just forget it
reviews.author: Gena Ofigenno

reviews.title: Don\'t bother yet
reviews.comment: This app is useless to me without the scan business card function found in the iOS version.   Don\'t bother installing it until Evernote finishes it.  It\'s not ready for prime time yet.
reviews.author: Lisa Jones

reviews.title: Frequently crashes
reviews.comment: The app tries to sync too often and crashes for no reason! Uninstalling :/
reviews.author: Raghavendra Kopalle

reviews.title: Stale (and forgotten?)
reviews.comment: I\'m a big Evernote fan, but it\'s hard not to feel like a second rate citizen when the feature set of this app is more than 6 months behind iOS. Bored now.
reviews.author: Sam Carson

reviews.title: Great Idea!
reviews.comment: I know that many people won\'t appreciate something like but if you meet new people every day or every short time! How would you remember them all if you don\'t have this app? You will get confused about their names and where did you meet them and may forget how they look like or need some way else to reach them like e-mail or twitter because you\'re using smart phone, now all this is in one app collected to relax your head.. All it miss is backup of contacts to get 5 stars!
reviews.author: Omar Octavenomur

reviews.title: Great app on iOS
reviews.comment: I love Evernote Hello on iOS. It has a newer cleaner interface. It\'s easier to use, it\'s fun, and useful. On iOS we also have card scanning.   The Android version sucks. I don\'t even bother and just use it on my iPad instead.
reviews.author: David Jensen

reviews.title: Love Evernote, but not this one
reviews.comment: I\'m a huge Evernote fan, but this secondary app was definitely released before it was ready for prime time. Many of the features are missing, and there\'s almost no direction on how to get started - something the core Evernote app does very well.
reviews.author: Jay Shapiro

reviews.title: Too much hassle
reviews.comment: I figure if I\'ve spent 30 minutes trying to figure an app out and what exactly it does, it\'s 27 mins too long. Love Evernote, but this isn\'t up to their standards. Love the concept though especially since I\'m terrible with names...improve ux and make it more intuitive and I\'ll be a fan.
reviews.author: Matt Kies

reviews.title: No Support for Nexus 7
reviews.comment: Might be something I\'d use but it is useless to me if it isn\'t available for my Nexus 7.
reviews.author: Edward Shea

reviews.title: Sadly lacking in features compared to iOS version
reviews.comment: Well, coming from my iPhone this was one of the first Business Apps I reached for when migrating.  This Android version is Sadly lacking and has now Business Card OCR Scanning facility which is a real shame as the iOS version scans Business cards very well.  Great potential but falls short.
reviews.author: Gary White

reviews.title: Scam NOT scan
reviews.comment: I love Evernote, but this app is garbage. I wanted a card scanner. Only the iOS version of the app apparently does that. Goodbye Hello.
reviews.author: Doug Wright

reviews.title: Completely useless without support for gmail
reviews.comment: Please add sync with gmail contacts, or else this app means nothing to me
reviews.author: tim feirg

reviews.title: Lost pictures and info
reviews.comment: If you connect with LinkedIn then you lose the pictures you have taken with the app. Same thing with title and other info you have entered that get overwritten by LinkedIn.  Please fix this asap.
reviews.author: Amir Banifatemi

reviews.title: Complete waste of time
reviews.comment: I used the iPhone app and I liked the fact that it would use OCR to scan business cards. The android app doesn\'t offer any of that functionality.  Skip it.
reviews.author: Roger Toppin

reviews.title: This is the solution to a problem I don\'t have
reviews.comment: I have been using Evernote on both Android and Apple for a while. Both work well. Only the Apple version of Hello currently scans business cards but I don\'t even need this app. Google Contacts works great, and if I want to save a business card, Evernote has been allowing this with searchable text for quite some time.
reviews.author: Jerry Stevens
